Dialogue.Page: Hello! Good to see you in the air!
I've explored this moon... a little...

DialogueOption.Text: What have you learned about this planet?
What do you think that tower is used for?
I'm going to take a look around.

Dialogue.Page: Well, the first thing I learned is that this planet is very scary.

The second thing I learned is that it is filled with <color=orange>sulfuric acid</color>, which is also very scary. The acid is <color=orange>falling</color> though, which is nice. Must be all the geysers launching it into orbit.
Thirdly, I found a Nomai <color=orange>clock tower</color> on the other side. Quite fascinating!
I didn't go inside, because... well... it's scary.
The tower on the other side of the moon? Obviously it's designed to keep time.
The real question is this: WHY did they need to keep track of the time? Was it just to measure the passage of time? Were they counting down to something?
That's the funny thing about the passage of time, <color=orange>it makes it easy to forget</color>. I know I never remember anything unless I <color=orange>write it down</color>.
Maybe I should write that down...
Don't fall into the sulfuric acid! I've heard it doesn't feel very good.
